body: I think the main problem is that ->fails() shouldn't throw exceptions no matter what input it gets.

@mantas-done this functionality was introduced in laravel 10.
https://github.com/laravel/framework/commit/e1f77941fd5f48b3684601dc173138d1d47bd696 pull request https://github.com/laravel/framework/pull/48002

@timacdonald can you please explain why you limited to 1000 the scale by default?

This will break also this example:

```php

 'currency_exchange_rate' => [
              'bail',
              'numeric',
              'gt:0',                                          // this will throw Math exception
              'regex:/^\d+(\.\d{1,10})?$/' // this should throw Validation Exception
    ]
```

Workaround 
```php

 'currency_exchange_rate' => [
              'bail',
              'numeric',
             // 'gt:0',
              'regex:/^\d+(\.\d{1,10})?$/' // this will throw Validation Exception
    ]
```

issue.title: [11.x] Fix validation to not throw incompatible validation exception
issue.body:
fixes #55944

body: @macropay-solutions, the exact value is somewhat arbitrary but seemed like a good default. The limit was an attack vector mitigation.
